textRegions.text: Hunting Mice with µs Circuit Switches

Nathan Farrington
George Porter

Amin Vahdat†

Lower CAPEX
Lower OPEX
Requires scheduling algorithm

Q. I am a packet. Do I go over the PSN or the CSN?
A. CSN. If a circuit exists between our pod and the destination pod, then the circuit setup time cost has already been paid.
Corollary. A scheduling algorithm should maximize the throughput over the CSN.

Q. I am a packet. Do I go over the PSN or the CSN?
A. CSN. If a circuit exists between our pod and the destination pod, then the circuit setup time cost has already been paid.
Corollary. A scheduling algorithm should maximize the throughput over the CSN.

Q. I am a packet. Do I go over the PSN or the CSN?
A. CSN. If a circuit exists between our pod and the destination pod, then the circuit setup time cost has already been paid.
Corollary. A scheduling algorithm should maximize the throughput over the CSN.
Q. I am a circuit switch. How should I be configured, both right now, and in the future?
In general, pods have unequal demands.
Units are percentage of total link capacity.
An admissible TDM has all row sums         and all column sums         less than or equal to 1.
Admissible is also called doubly substochastic.

We want admissible TDMs because
Pods cannot send more than their link capacity.
Pods cannot receive more than their link capacity.

Any TDM can be made admissible
with linear scaling.

Any TDM can be made admissible
with linear scaling.

Instead of scaling the TDM,
we will allocate the bandwidth.
A BAM is called doubly stochastic.

Stochastic scaling uses the TDM
to compute the BAM.
Stop when you have enough precision.
A circuit switch can be represented as both a bipartite graph and as an adjacency matrix.

A maximal assignment on the bipartite graph
is a permutation matrix.
Compute the max-weighted maximal matching (the maximum matching) on the BAM.

Hotspot Scheduling is best for hotspot traffic
and worst for all-to-all traffic.
Lengthy computation before every circuit switch reconfiguration.
Speeding up the switch technology does not speed up the computation.
Performance is too dependent on communication patterns.

The BvN expansion is a
convex combination.
We don’t need to use all the terms.

In this example:
The first term is the same as Hotspot Scheduling. 
The first two terms provide 53.8% of the capacity.
How does Traffic Matrix Scheduling perform?

If your duty cycle is 90%,
then your 10G link becomes a 9G link.

Which is fine if your offered load
is not more than 9G.

If offered load is less than
9 Gb/s, we can achieve 100%
throughput over the CSN.

n: number of time slots
CSN: circuit-switched network
PSN: packet-switched network
D: duty cycle
Each host requires this much buffering.

notes.slide-6:
“Previous hybrid data center network projects used a wide array of technologies, but all converged independently on the same circuit scheduling algorithm, that we call hotspot scheduling.
“Hotspot scheduling has a few problems.
“First, the throughput achieved by hotspot scheduling is entirely dependent on the workload.
“If your traffic has lots of hotspots, then hotspot scheduling will perform very well.
“But if your traffic looks more like all-to-all with few hotspots, then hotspot scheduling will perform very poorly.
“Another problem is that hotspot scheduling requires a lengthy computation before every circuit switch reconfiguration, meaning that the reconfiguration time will be dominated by processing rather than circuit switching, and it is not clear how to take advantage of faster microsecond and nanosecond switch technologies.
“In this talk, we propose a generalization of hotspot scheduling, that we call traffic matrix scheduling.
“Traffic matrix scheduling achieves 100% throughput on all workloads.
“However, this result depends upon the interplay of three variables: the switching time, the amount of buffering on the hosts, and the offered load.
“We will go into more detail later in the talk.
“Another benefit of traffic matrix scheduling is that the lengthy computation is amortized across hundreds to thousands of circuit switch reconfigurations.
“This means that traffic matrix scheduling benefits enormously from faster switching technologies.
“Unfortunately, traffic matrix scheduling also requires faster switching technologies due to the limitations on host buffering.
notes.slide-40: “In this talk we presented a new scheduling algorithm for hybrid data center networks that achieves 100% throughput across all workloads.
notes.slide-17: “We must bring balance to the force.
